p: Zinc belongs to the essential trace elements that act as a co-factor for enzymes important for ensuring the proper functioning of the antioxidant defense system. Physiological or adequate levels of zinc protect cells against oxidative damage through the stabilization of cell membranes, inhibition of pro-oxidant enzymes, induction of antioxidant system response and metallothionein synthesis, all of which play a central role in oxidoreductive cellular metabolism [ 14, 15]. Pivoto et al. [ 7] reported that zinc edetate administered subcutaneously could contribute to the alleviation of the oxidative stress induced by H. contortus in lambs.
